column5: I will be traveling to NW Ontario through International Falls/Fort Frances on Friday. My group has downsized our packages of salted minnows to comply with the 120 minnow/person limit. Has anyone recently taken salted minnows across the border at Fort Frances? If so, what was your experience at the border? Many thanks....

We crossed the border at Baudette on the 18th and they did ask what kind of bait we had. When we replied that we had 215 salted minnows for the two of us, the officer chuckled and asked, " You really counted them? ". Easy crossing. PjShorthorn.
It's a good thing they didn't check Fishoil when he crossed. He'd still be in jail. He was waaaay over his 120 salted minnow limit.

If you want an easy crossing just follow the rules. Unfortunately thawing and refreezing the salties turned them to mush. We jettisoned them early in the trip. Too bad because I have had really good luck on the salties.Frank
Adding a bit of Borax might help. I dry mine in the sun before packaging and they last a long time without being frozen. Leave them in the sun too long and they become too stiff.
The key is to not freeze them. Salt them and keep them cool in the fridge, they will last awhile.
I have some in the frig which have never been frozen from last fall. They appear to be questionably OK. Next make pizza night, I'll check them out. Bill
Are salted minnows a pizza topping in Iowa ??? PjShorthorn.
